intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Time to wake up, Lord/Lady Corrin!

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Hey, wake up, Lord/Lady Corrin! Up and at 'em!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Hrmmm...What are you talking about? It's still dark outside.

intro.speaker: Gunter
intro.line: Listen well, Prince. It may be dark, but it is indeed in the morning. You have practice today.

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: I have taken the liberty of reading your armor, and, er, pounding out the dents. Your brother is a fearsome opponent, is he not?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ugh. Fine. I'm still not completely awake though...

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Oh, we can help you with that! Felicia, would you please assist me?

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Sure thing!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Waauuugh! Cold cold cold! I'm awake! Totally awake now!

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: That's how we deal with slugabeds in the Ice Tribe!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: *sigh* Trust me, I know. I wish I could have finished the dream I was having though...

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: Interesting. Do tell-what kind of dream was it?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It was...strange. Some people who look like Hoshidans kept calling me their brother/sister. But all of my brothers and sisters are here in Nohr...

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Ah, Lord/Lady Corrin, perhaps we should talk about your dream another time?

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: It's time for you to get going, milord/milady. Prince Xander is waiting for you!

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: That's our brother/sister for you. You won't beat the strongest knight in Nohr by sleeping all day, Corrin!

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Giving up so soon, Corrin? I expect more of you. You are a prince/princess of Nohr! Pick up your sword and try again.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: But, Xander, I-

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: We train like this so that we can defend ourselves from our enemies. Father has been tracking your progress. If you can't land a hit on me today...he may never permit you to leave the Northern Fortress. Ever.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What?! D-did he really say that? That's insane!

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Motivated, are we? Then use that fire to best me in battle, little Prince/Princess. If you would see the outside world beyond the view from your window, defeat me. Prove that all of the time I've devoted to training you have not be in vain!

battle.speaker: Xander
battle.line: The first move is yours, Corrin. Come at me when you are ready.

battle.speaker: Xander
battle.line: You swing timidly, without resolve. You must genuinely try to kill me.

battle.speaker: Xander
battle.line: Hmm, looks like that wound needs attention. In that case...

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Ah! There was a Dragon Vein here?

battle.speaker: Xander
battle.line: Yes. You should have sensed it as well. The blood of dragons flows in your veins, as it does in all royals. You must learn to harness this draconic power wherever you may find it. Heal your wounds, Corrin, then find the courage to come at me again.

battle.speaker: Xander
battle.line: Good. Now that you've recovered some of your strength, try again!

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Brother... how are you... so strong...?

battle.speaker: Xander
battle.line: Is that all it takes to defeat you? What a shame. I guess you don't wish to leave this fortress after all...

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Well done, Corrin. You're getting stronger every day.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Thanks, Xander. I couldn't have done it without your, uh, tough love.

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: I disagree. I believe you have natural talent. Some day, you could be the greatest warrior in all of Nohr.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Now you're just teasing me.

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: You know me, Corrin. I never joke about serious matters. I mean what I say. You could be the one to bring light to our kingdom so long shrouded in darkness.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Xander...

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Typical. You know that true strength is more than simple swordplay, right?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Leo, he didn't mean-

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Calm yourself, little brother. You really are competitive to a fault. As I've always said, you're a talented mage with formidable magical abilities.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Hmm. Well, just remember that pointy metal sticks are not the only path to power.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Oh, that reminds me of something I've been meaning to tell you, Leo.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Something important enough to derail this conversation?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Well...your collar is inside out.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: What?!

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: It would appear someone got dressed while still half-asleep.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Ugh! Wh-why didn't you say something earlier?!

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Haha, sorry, Leo. But that sort of thing is what makes you so lovable.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Absolutely.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Hmph...

end.speaker: Camilla
end.line: Are you all right, Corrin? Did you get hurt at all during practice? If you did, let me know right away so I can take extra-special care of you...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I'm perfectly fine, Camilla. As always, thanks for your concern.

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: I was worried about you too, Corrin!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I know, Elise. You wouldn't visit me all the time if you didn't care so much, right?

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Heehee... Do you like it when I visit?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Of course! I'm not allowed to leave this fortress, so visits are all I look forward to!

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Yaaay! I'm glad to hear that. Spending time with my brother/sister makes me so happy!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Gah!

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: I love you so much! I love you more than anything in the whole, wide world!

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Elise, when do you intend to behave like the adult that you technically are?

end.speaker: Camilla
end.line: Well, I for one think her cheer is a good complement to this gloomy kingdom, Leo.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Well said, Camilla. Every one of you is so dear to me. You've all been so patient and kind since I lost my memory... I don't even mind being quarantined when I'm with you. I'm so grateful to have you all.

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: We are grateful to have you as well. But, Corrin, I have some-

end.speaker: Camilla
end.line: Let me tell him/her, Xander! We have wonderful news, Corrin! Father asked us to take you back to the capital!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Really?! Does that mean...

end.speaker: Camilla
end.line: Yes. It means you can finally leave this drafty fortress. You must have been so lonely all this time, separated from the rest of the world... But now you'll be free!

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Isn't that wonderful?!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It...it really is. Thanks, Elise. Wow... I'm finally leaving this place... Maybe now I can join you all as a soldier, fighting for Nohr?

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: There will be plenty of time to discuss the details with Father. Let us depart.

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: I hear you can finally leave the fortress. You must be very happy, Lord/Lady Corrin. Gunter has asked me to go with you to the capital so I can look after your horses.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Glad to hear it! I'd miss you if you weren't coming along too.

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Lilith, are the horses ready?

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: Yes, milord. Everything is ready, and the horses seem excited about the trip. They are all very fond of Lord/Lady Corrin. Probably from all his/her time in the stables...

end.speaker: Camilla
end.line: Our Corrin does love animals. Such a kindhearted soul... Why he/she even nursed an injured baby bird back to health one time!

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: Ah...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Lilith, is something wrong?

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: Oh...no. It's nothing.

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Isn't it obvious, Corrin? Lilith is sad because she's going to miss you!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Miss me? But she's coming with us.

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Oh, right! Well then, I bet she's sad 'cause she won't have you all to herself anymore. You've always been especially fond of our brother/sister, haven't you, Lilith?

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: I, er-

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: As gripping as all this is, we should be on our way. We mustn't keep Father waiting.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes, let's go!

end.speaker: Gunter
end.line: Flora, you and Felicia/Jakob will remain here to watch over the fortress. Felicia/Jakob and I will accompany Lord/Lady Corrin. We may be gone for some time. Take good care of this place.

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Of course! You may rely on us.

end.speaker: Felicia
end.line: Safe travels, Lady Corrin!

end.speaker: Jakob
end.line: I wish you safe travels, Lord Corrin.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Thank you. I hope to see both of you again soon...just not here!
